column4: Need some help figuring out what device to mount for a new SATA I just put in. Could it be "sg0"?
try 'sudo fdisk -l' and see what looks promising  - ive never seen a sg0
OK, I am running a Dell server, and I have 4 SATA's set in RAID array. fdisk only pulls up the 4 SATAs. I just installed a 5th SATA to be used outside of the array.
no idea then on raids..   could be somthign special you have to do.
